meta.name: Audit Interview Feedback & Report via Slack with GPT-4o-mini and Google Sheets

parameters.content:
‚úÖ Validate AI Response
Type: Conditional Logic
Purpose: Quality control checkpoint
Validation:

Response text is not undefined
Contains valid data structure

Routing:

‚úÖ Valid ‚Üí Continue to JSON parsing
‚ùå Invalid ‚Üí Log to error sheet

Function: Prevents malformed responses from corrupting pipeline

ü§ñ AI Quality Evaluator (GPT-4o)
Type: AI Language Model
Purpose: Cognitive engine for feedback analysis
Configuration:

Model: gpt-4o-mini
Platform: Azure OpenAI
Integration: LangChain

Connects to Azure GPT-4o-mini
Powers NLP evaluation
Generates structured JSON outputs

üîç Analyze Feedback Quality
Type: LangChain LLM Chain
Purpose: Core AI evaluation engine
Evaluation Dimensions (1-5 Scale):

Specificity (35%) - Concrete details
Structure/STAR (15%) - Situation-Task-YOUR_OPENAI_KEY_HERE-Result
Bias-Free Language (15%) - No gender/appearance bias
Actionability (10%) - Decision usefulness
Depth (25%) - Multiple competencies

Scoring:

5: Excellent - Clear STAR with evidence
3: Adequate - Some info but vague
1: Unusable - Purely subjective

Special Rules:

Feedback <30 words ‚Üí Scores ‚â§2
Extracts vague phrases ("great guy", "nice energy")

Output: JSON with scores and vague_phrases array

üìã Fetch Interview Feedback
Type: Google Sheets Read
Purpose: Retrieve raw feedback data
Configuration:

Document: Interviewer Brief Pack
Sheet: Raw_Feedback
Operation: Read all rows

Data Retrieved:
Timestamp, Candidate_ID, Role, Stage, Interviewer_Email, Feedback_Text, row_number
Output: All feedback records passed to AI evaluation

üîÑ Parse AI JSON Output
Type: JavaScript Code
Purpose: Convert string to structured data
Function:

Safely parses AI text to JSON object
Try-catch error handling
Throws descriptive errors for debugging

üéØ Check if Training Needed
Type: Conditional Logic
Purpose: Identify low performers
Condition: Score < 50
Routing:

‚úÖ <50 ‚Üí Send training resources
‚ùå ‚â•50 ‚Üí No additional action

Function: Triggers enhanced coaching for scores below threshold

üìö Send Training Recommendations
Type: Slack Notification
Purpose: Deliver coaching resources
Message Content:

Score, Flags, Specific vague phrases
Improvement guidance (STAR method)
üìò STAR Method Guide link
üé• Bias-Free Interviewing Video link

Function:

Detailed coaching for scores <50
Links to training resources
Supportive, growth-focused tone

üö® Log AI Errors
Type: Google Sheets Append
Purpose: Error tracking
Configuration:

Sheet: error log sheet
Operation: APPEND

Function:

Captures AI failures
Creates error audit trail
Enables debugging and monitoring
Tracks system reliability

üí¨ Send Feedback Summary
Type: Slack Notification
Purpose: Deliver quality report
Message Structure:

Role, Stage, Score (X/100), Flags
High Quality: Congratulations message
Needs Improvement: Vague phrases + STAR tips

Function:

Immediate feedback to interviewer
Specific, actionable guidance
Encourages continuous improvement

üíæ Save Scores to Spreadsheet
Type: Google Sheets Update
Purpose: Persist quality metrics
Configuration:

Sheet: Raw_Feedback
Operation: UPDATE (match by row_number)

Fields Updated:

Score (0-100)
Flags (quality issues)
LLM_JSON (complete AI analysis)

Function: Updates original rows, creates audit trail for trend analysis

üßÆ Calculate Weighted Quality Score
Type: JavaScript Code
Purpose: Compute final score and flags
Weights:
Specificity 35% | Depth 25% | Structure 15% | Bias-Free 15% | Actionability 10%
Flags:

"low_detail": specificity < 3 OR depth < 3
"bias": bias_free_language < 3

Function:

Calculates 0-100 score
Generates quality flags
Formats vague phrases for Slack
Preserves context (Role, Stage, row_number)

Output: Score, Flags, LLM_JSON, VaguePhrasesFormatted

parameters.text:
=You are an Interview Feedback Quality Auditor.

Your task is to evaluate interviewer feedback notes and score them across 5 dimensions:
- specificity (1‚Äì5)
- structure_STAR (1‚Äì5)
- bias_free_language (1‚Äì5)
- actionability (1‚Äì5)
- depth (1‚Äì5)

‚öñÔ∏è Scoring Guidelines:
- 5 = Excellent: Clear, detailed, STAR format (Situation, Task, Action, Result) explicitly used or strongly implied, with evidence/examples.
- 4 = Good: Mostly structured, some detail, minor gaps, still useful for decisions.
- 3 = Adequate: Some relevant info but mixed with vagueness, missing STAR elements.
- 2 = Poor: Mostly vague or generic, no clear evidence, over-reliant on subjective phrasing.
- 1 = Unusable: Purely subjective (‚Äúgreat guy‚Äù, ‚Äúnice energy‚Äù), no actionable details.

Bias-free language: Score low if feedback references gender, looks, personality, or irrelevant traits.

Actionability: Score higher if the feedback directly helps in making a decision (e.g., ‚Äúpassed all test cases under time constraint‚Äù vs ‚Äúseems smart‚Äù).

Depth: Score higher if multiple competencies or dimensions are covered, lower if only 1 vague point.

üö® Additional Rules:
- If text <30 words OR contains mostly emojis/placeholders ‚Üí set ALL scores ‚â§2 and add `"too_short"` to vague_phrases.
- Extract vague phrases (e.g., ‚Äúgood energy‚Äù, ‚Äúsmart guy‚Äù, ‚Äúshould be fine‚Äù) into `"vague_phrases"` array.

Return ONLY valid JSON in this schema:
{
  "specificity": <1‚Äì5>,
  "structure": <1‚Äì5>,
  "bias_free_language": <1‚Äì5>,
  "actionability": <1‚Äì5>,
  "depth": <1‚Äì5>,
  "vague_phrases": [ ... ]
}

messageValues.message: You are an Interview Feedback Quality Auditor.   Evaluate interview feedback for specificity, structure (STAR), bias-free language, actionability, and depth.   Be strict but fair. Always return **only valid JSON** that follows the given schema.Return ONLY valid JSON, no explanations, no markdown, no quotes wrapping the whole object.

parameters.text:
=:books: *Training Recommendation*

Your interview feedback for **{{$json["Role"]}} ({{$json["Stage"]}})** was reviewed.

üìä **Score:** {{$json["Score"]}}/100  
‚ö†Ô∏è **Flags:** {{$json["Flags"] || "none"}}  

We noticed vague or incomplete feedback. Here are some examples:  
{{  $json.VaguePhrasesFormatted }}

To improve: try using structured, evidence-based feedback (e.g., STAR method).  

üëâ Helpful resources:  
üìò [STAR Method Guide](https://example.com/star-training)  
üé• [Bias-Free Interviewing Video](https://example.com/interview-bias)  

Your detailed notes help us make fairer hiring decisions üöÄ
